title: Responsive Design with Bootstrap
author: Emil Jacobsson
description: Bootstrap is a helpful toolkit for web development. It's quite popular and makes it easier to create good-looking websites that work well on different devices. Bootstrap was initially created by Twitter developers, and now many other people contribute to it.With Bootstrap, you get many pre-built components like buttons, forms, and menus. These components use HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, which help web developers save time and effort since they don't have to build everything from scratch.One of the best features of Bootstrap is its responsive design. This means that websites made with Bootstrap can automatically adapt to various screen sizes, like desktop computers, laptops, tablets, and smartphones. It uses a grid system to organize the layout into rows and columns.Bootstrap also has many pre-designed themes and styles that you can customize to match the look you want for your website. This is a big time-saver for developers and helps to keep a consistent design across different projects.To use Bootstrap in web development, you just need to include the framework's files (CSS and JavaScript) in your HTML file. Then, you can use the pre-defined classes and components provided by Bootstrap to build your website.In short, Bootstrap is a user-friendly web development framework that makes it simpler for developers to create responsive and visually appealing websites. It offers pre-built components, a flexible grid system, and various themes to help save time and maintain consistency in web projects.

title: HTML - an introduction
author: Albert Gustavsson
description: HTML(HyperText Markup Language), is the basic building block used to create websites. It's a simple language that helps you structure and organize content on a webpage, like text, images, and links.In HTML, you use something called
to create the structure of a webpage. Tags are like little labels that tell the web browser how to display the content. For example, you might use the
tag to create a paragraph or the
tag for a big heading. You usually have an opening tag, like
, and a closing tag, like
, that wraps around the content.HTML documents have a standard structure, which starts with a
declaration to let the browser know it's dealing with an HTML file. Then, you'll have an opening
tag and a closing
tag. Inside the HTML tags, you'll find two main sections: the
and the
. The
section contains information about the page, like its title, and links to external files like CSS or JavaScript. The

section is where you put all the content you want to show on the webpage, like text, images, and links.One important thing to know about HTML is that it's not a programming language. It doesn't have logic or functions like JavaScript or Python. Instead, it's a markup language that helps you structure and organize content on a webpage.To create a webpage with HTML, you write the HTML code in a text editor and save it with a

file extension. You can then open the file in a web browser to see how it looks. As you learn more about HTML, you can combine it with other languages like CSS (for styling) and JavaScript (for interactivity) to create more advanced websites.In summary, HTML is a simple language used to structure content on webpages. It uses tags to organize elements like text, images, and links, and it's the foundation of every website. Learning HTML is an essential first step for anyone interested in web development.
